title: Ticket #7106: Small bugs in DAGMan fast submit
description:
In #6386 we added the DAGMAN_AGGRESSIVE_SUBMIT configuration knob. When set to true, this allows a user to bypass the DAGMAN_USER_LOG_SCAN_INTERVAL time limit if they still have jobs ready to submit. There are two small bugs with this implementation:

  1. In the param_info file there's a typo in the knob name.

  2. DAGMan alternates between a submit cycle and a sleep cycle. The duration of the submit cycle is defined in DAGMAN_USER_LOG_SCAN_INTERVAL, however this knob also defines the duration of the sleep cycle. So it's impossible to change one without changing the other. We need a new knob called DAGMAN_SLEEP_CYCLE_INTERVAL that only sets the duration of the sleep cycle.
remarks:
2019-Jun-12 14:56:03 by coatsworth:
It turns out that # 2 is more complicated than it looks. The main problem is that introducing a new knob would involve renaming the existing DAGMAN_USER_LOG_SCAN_INTERVAL for naming consistency. Moreover, a user can already prolong the duration of the submit cycle by enabling DAGMAN_AGGRESSIVE_SUBMIT and then tuning DAGMAN_MAX_SUBMITS_PER_INTERVAL accordingly. So I'm just going to leave this as-is.

This means the only bug fix on this ticket is a 1-character typo. I've pushed the fix, now I'm going to assign this to Todd Miller from whom I expect an extensive code review :)
